com.tencent.tcr.sdk.api

Class ScalingHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tencent.tcr.sdk.api.ScalingHandler

  • public class ScalingHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    The two-finger pinch zoom handler class, which implements two-finger pinch zoom and two-finger swipe operations on the view.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ScalingHandler(PcTouchHandler mTouchHandler) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Enable two-finger pinch zoom on the game video image.

      Perform two-finger pinch zoom and swipe based on the gesture.

      Reset the zoom of the game video image.

      Set the two-finger pinch zoom listener.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScalingHandler

        public ScalingHandler(PcTouchHandler mTouchHandler)

    • Method Detail

      • enableScaling

        public void enableScaling(float min,
                          float max)
        Enable two-finger pinch zoom on the game video image.
        Parameters:
        min - The minimum zoom ratio, which must be greater than 0.
        max - The maximum zoom ratio, which must be greater than 1.

      • onTouch

        public boolean onTouch(View view,
                       MotionEvent event)
        Perform two-finger pinch zoom and swipe based on the gesture.
        Parameters:
        view - The view to be zoomed
        event - The current touch operation
        Returns:
        true: The zoom operation has been performed (currently, zoom can be supported by gestures involving at least two fingers).

      • resetScaling

        public void resetScaling()
        Reset the zoom of the game video image.

      • setOnPinchZoomListener

        public void setOnPinchZoomListener(PinchListener listener)
        Set the two-finger pinch zoom listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - IPinchZoomListener

      • setPinchOffset

        public void setPinchOffset(Rect rect)
        Set the offsets of the video image frame during zoom. This allows the game video image to be slid out of the phone screen borders.
        Parameters:
        rect - The size of the area within which the video image can slide out of the four borders of the phone screen. The coordinates are all `0` by default.
